definition[0]: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
example[0]: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
example[2]: The coach has to find a substitute for Tim.
definition[1]: a person or thing that you use instead of the one that you usually have, because the usual one is not available
definition[2]: to use something new or different instead of something else
example[5]: The recipe says you can substitute yoghurt for the sour cream.
definition[3]: to do someone’s job until the person who usually does it is able to do it again
example[6]: Bill substituted for Larry, who was off sick.
definition[4]: to replace someone with another person, especially another player
example[7]: Michael Owen had to be substituted after 20 minutes on the field.
definition[5]: something new or different that can be used instead of something else
example[8]: Sugar substitutes are used by the soft drinks industry.
example[9]: Training is important but it is no substitute for (=cannot take the place of) experience.
definition[6]: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time
example[10]: We need to find a substitute while she is sick.
definition[7]: to use or do something new or different instead of something else
example[11]: Corporations have been able to avoid some tax by substituting debt for equity.
example[12]: Byproducts are reduced if a different bleaching agent is substituted for pure chlorine.
definition[8]: to be used or done instead of something else
example[13]: Synthetic fuels are liquids or gases which may be substituted for oil products or natural gas.
example[14]: Bill substituted for Larry who was off sick.
